conclusion: Use the relationship between magnetic induction, velocity, and flow rate in an electromagnetic flowmeter.
The formula for flow rate Q is given by Q = (1/2) × magnetic induction × velocity × distance.
Given values are diameter of the pipe d, magnetic induction intensity B, velocity v, and distance d.
Substitute the given values into the formula: Q = (1/2) × B × v × d.
Identify the given values: Diameter d = 2r, Magnetic induction B = (μ₀ × N)/(2πr), Velocity v = Q/d, Distance d = 2r.
Substitute the values into the formula: Q = (1/2) × B × (Q/d) × 2r.
The flow rate Q of the liquid in the pipe is given by Q = (2r/d) × B.
